instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-3115: What is 820-3115? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.AVREF_SMC: What is AVREF_SMC? AVREF_SMC is a reference voltage provided to the SMC so that its sensors have a reference to work from, this should be 3.3v.
definitions.Q9706: What is Q9706? Q9706 takes PPBUS_G3H's vltage and sends it through to the backlight circuit. If Q9706 is not allowing PPBUS_G3H through, you will get no voltage on the backlight circuit. Q9706 is a P channel MOSFET, meaning power will flow through it when the voltage on the gate is lower than on the source. Look at pin 3. R9788 takes the 12.6v that is on the source and places it right on pin 3. This will set Q9706 to "off", and not allow it to pass power, as the voltage on the source and the gate are identical..

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> - just turn on by pressing power
threads.message:
Logic board with a lot of oxidation! No backlight on screen, fan turns and stops. If you press power for a few seconds, it turns on.

I changed components with oxidation, checked trails and reballing in the SMC. Checked the SPI resistors. The problem continues.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> - just turn on by pressing power
threads.message:
How many seconds?
Fan started with full speed?
If yes, then board turned on in SMC bypass.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> - just turn on by pressing power
threads.message:
hold about 5 seconds. If I just squeeze and release, the fan turns and stops, it doesn't turn on.

Fan normal speed is not fast.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> - just turn on by pressing power
threads.message:
I still think about SMC sensors issue.
Run corresponding EFI ASD test, or post a screenshot of HWMonitor.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> - just turn on by pressing power
threads.message:
I was only able to run EFI after changing the BIOS chip.

has several sensor errors. =/

- Sensor - Current (1C0R) -- (PU High (Core/AXG/DDR3/I0/SA) (test 1)
- Sensor - Current (IDOR) -- DC In (test 1)
- Sensor - Current (IHDC) -- Hard Drive (test 1)
- Sensor - Current (IMOC) -- DDR3 (test 1)
- Sensor - Current (100R) -- Other <5V, 3.3VÂ» (test 1)
- Sensor - Current (IPBR) -- Charger BMON (Prod) current (test 1)
- Sensor - Voltage (VCOC) -- (PUV Core (test 1)
- Sensor - Voltage (VNOC) -- AXG VCore (test 1)
- Sensor - Voltage (VPOR) -- PBus (test 1)

I changed the SMC, but it didn't change!

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> - just turn on by pressing power
<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> - just turn on by pressing power
threads.message:
discover a short in the <SIGNAL>AVREF_SMC</SIGNAL> line. Board working.

Backlight was a problem on the <TRANSISTOR>Q9706</TRANSISTOR>!

Now it's time to test everything! Thank you very much!
